channel.title: Windows 8
channel.description:
Is shit. Just some tablet shit mashed on top of 7.
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/home/

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:58, topic:414650”]The front end is the main thing. They’re adapting windows to a tablet world.

But there are some useful things, like the new task manager is rather brilliant, they’re adopting this whole continuous client type thing. You sign in with your live ID, and if the PC is enabled to do so, then it’ll pull your preferences down to that PC, including all the metro apps (and only metro apps) so it is, at least on the front end - exactly the same as your PC.

They’re also doing some new stuff with storage:


http://www.techspot.com/news/46943-windows-8-adds-raid-like-storage-pooling-and-fault-tolerance.html[/quote]It’s still worth noting that metro will most likely not be the default UI for a desktop-pc you purchase anywhere (someone will inevitably come and whine about it). It simply isn’t practical in that regard, and you can revert to the classic look with little effort should you have metro as standard for some mind-boggling reason.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

The front end is the main thing. They’re adapting windows to a tablet world.

But there are some useful things, like the new task manager is rather brilliant, they’re adopting this whole continuous client type thing. You sign in with your live ID, and if the PC is enabled to do so, then it’ll pull your preferences down to that PC, including all the metro apps (and only metro apps) so it is, at least on the front end - exactly the same as your PC.

They’re also doing some new stuff with storage:


TechSpot

Windows 8 adds RAID-like storage pooling and fault tolerance

An interesting article has been posted to the MSDN blog, thoroughly outlining a new Windows 8 feature called "Storage Spaces". The technology will allow users to create a single storage volume from multiple storage devices. The feature...

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:50, topic:414650”][quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=516612.msg3877691#msg3877691 date=1325791389]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=516612.msg3877652#msg3877652 date=1325789655]

[quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=516612.msg3877633#msg3877633 date=1325788924]
thats how vista and 7 worked…
[/quote]Except its not.
[/quote]How is it not? They offered full installation or upgrade.
[/quote]Because this is during runtime in the OS, not from an external media. You can actually reformat your pc straight from windows (i’m guessing it creates a new temporary partition for the Windows files and then just merges it back when done).[/quote]Ahh, I didn’t read the article just the extract.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Teh Spede, post:49, topic:414650”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=516612.msg3877652#msg3877652 date=1325789655]

[quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=516612.msg3877633#msg3877633 date=1325788924]
thats how vista and 7 worked…
[/quote]Except its not.
[/quote]How is it not? They offered full installation or upgrade.[/quote]Because this is during runtime in the OS, not from an external media. You can actually reformat your pc straight from windows (i’m guessing it creates a new temporary partition for the Windows files and then just merges it back when done).

item.title: Windows 8
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

Finalized builds of Win8 will offer a pair of related features; 'Reset your PC' will allow you to remove all personal data, apps, and settings from the PC, and reinstall Windows, while 'Refresh your PC' enables your to keep all personal data, Metro style apps, and important settings from the PC, and reinstall Windows.
http://www.engadget.com/2012/01/05/windows-8-refresh-and-reset-options-bootable-usb/

Read full topic
